question_stem: A curve is defined by the equation \(y = \frac{5}{x^3} - 7x^4\).

parts.solution_text:
Given \(y = \frac{5}{x^3} - 7x^4\), we can rewrite this as \(y = 5x^{-3} - 7x^4\).
Differentiating with respect to \(x\), we use the power rule: 
\(\frac{dy}{dx} = 5(-3)x^{-3-1} - 7(4)x^{4-1}\)
\(\frac{dy}{dx} = -15x^{-4} - 28x^3\)
So, \(\frac{dy}{dx} = -\frac{15}{x^4} - 28x^3\).
